questions.question: Which one is the non-geometrical defect:

explanations.b: Laps and folds are geometrical defects.
explanations.d: Flakes are internal defects caused by improper cooling.

questions.question: The defect caused due to the sharp edges of the die protruding against the billet:

explanations.a: Buckling is caused by improper billet dimensions.
explanations.b: Shearing occurs due to excessive metal flow.
explanations.c: Cold shut occurs due to improper die design and sharp edges.
explanations.d: Underfill occurs due to insufficient material.

questions.question: The underfill defect can be avoided by:

answers.c: Using billet of the same volume as that of the die cavity

explanations.c: Correct billet volume ensures complete cavity filling.

questions.question: The material comes out of the die cavity in which of the following defect:

explanations.a: Underfill is due to insufficient material.
explanations.d: Overfill causes material to flow out as flash.

questions.question: The defect caused due to the improper cleaning of the billet work surface:

explanations.a: Scale pits occur due to oxide and scale on billet surface.
explanations.b: Flakes are caused by improper cooling.
explanations.c: Shearing is due to excessive deformation.
explanations.d: Buckling is due to poor billet design.
